==Growth and Harvest Aura Setup (Wacan + Passho Handoff)== Combining the [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Wacan]] and [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Passho]] setups is incredibly useful when trying to quickly grow and harvest multiple Gen 5 berries that have a base 0.5 berry harvest yield, such as Starf or Petaya. This two-part setup, going from the Wacan formation to the following Passho formation, is the most efficient way to harvest more of these berries in the shortest amount of time. Using Farmhands Jessie or Riley to either: harvest and replant Wacans, or just replant Wacans as they wither (which is faster, but requires actively watching out for Kasib mutations on withered plots) is the best way to cultivate slow growing Gen 5 berries in a reasonable amount of time. Due to the very low harvest amount, completely surrounding each Berry with 8 Passho berries is the best way to maximize harvest amounts.
For maximum efficiency you should swap from the Wacan formation to the Passho formation before the Gen-5 berries are ripe. It takes a little bit of math to perform this swap correctly due to the Wacan Growth aura variably affecting the Gen-5 berries depending on what stage the Wacan berries are in, but if you multiply the shown 'Time until Ripe' by the 'Aura Received' you get how much longer the Gen-5 berry has until it would be ripe without the Wacan Berries' effect. Since it takes some time for the Passho berries to grow, first calculate the actual time until ripe (without modifiers), and then harvest every Wacan berry when the Gen-5 berry has less time until it's ripe than it will take the Passho to ripen (including any growth multipliers ([[Sprayduck]], [[Farm Items|Boost Mulch]]) you're using on the Passho berries. Make sure to apply [[Farm_Items|Rich Mulch]] before harvesting the Gen-5 Berries! Using this strategy will yield 32 (28 cumulative) Gen-5 berries harvested per cycle.

==[[Wandering Pokémon]] Setups== Wandering Pokemon are attracted to ripe berries. For the maximum chance of attracting a desired wandering pokemon, use one of the setups below.
===Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry=== Using a single Lum berry surrounded by 7 Roseli berries, and then filling the remainder of open Farm spots with an Attracting Berry (a Berry that attracts a particular species of Wandering Pokémon) is the most effective way of attracting Wandering Pokémon to the Farm. *''Note: Do not use this setup with Occa, Colbur, or Kebia Berries. Due to their nature of overtaking other berries, it is most efficient to simply plant 25 of those berries'' {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Encounter Chance per 1.5s: 1.29%, Attract Aura: 1.51x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | [[File:Roseli.png|30px]]

===Roseli + Lum + Petaya + Attracting Berry ===
For a significantly longer uptime than [[Farming Setups#Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry|Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry]] to attract a Wandering Pokémon - perhaps if you're looking for a specific pokemon or group of pokemon to turn shiny for example - replace a Roseli Berry with a Petaya berry. This doesn't decrease the encounter chance per second significantly, but it does make this setup viable for several days instead of several hours.

==Squirtbottle Leveling Strategies== Here are a few highly efficient strategies on how to level up the Squirtbottle based on which berries you have unlocked.
====Occa/Kebia Planting Formation==== If you want to be able to gain experience more passively, then the best strategy is with Occa and Kebia berries. Colbur works for this as well, but takes longer enough to grow that is isn't as useful. This strategy will likely let you level up your Squirtbottle from 0 to 5 without having to set it up again unless you get unlucky with a full takeover. Note: When using this strategy, make sure to plant the berries so that they finish at the same time to lower the chance of full takeover.

====Persim Planting Formation==== Another common strategy includes mutating [[Persim]] berries if you haven't unlocked Occa, Kebia, or Colbur yet. You can find the formation and timings on the [[Persim]] page. This is a very active strategy, but this setup should provide a little over 3.58 mutations per minute on average including time waiting for growth. This strategy is also the fastest, but needs at least about 4 and a half hours of active growth and mutation time to complete.
==Sprinklotad Leveling Strategy== The most efficient way to gain experience for the [[Sprinklotad]] is to equip the fully-leveled [[Sprayduck]] and surround 4 Kasibs with Cheris in the following way. Keep replanting Cheris as they wither while either shoveling or harvesting extra Kasibs that sprout.

=Other Useful Setups= Other useful Berry setups can be found on these pages: * [[Pokémon_Day_Care|Maximizing Egg step gain for Breeding Pokemon faster]] * [[Shiny Chance|Maximizing Shiny Chance to turn all Pokemon Shiny]]
[[Category:Farm]]

[[File:Pokeclicker_Farm_Interface.png|400px|thumb|L'interface de la Ferme, avec différentes baies plantées.]] Il existe de nombreuses configurations de Ferme (ou : organisations des baies) ne permettant ni de faire éclore [[Pokémon_Day_Care|les œufs]] plus rapidement, ni d'augmenter les chances de rencontrer un [[Shiny Chance|Pokémon chromatique]], mais qui sont néanmoins utiles. Celles-ci peuvent notamment permettre de faire muter les baies plus rapidement, ou simplement d'augmenter les rendements de récole afin d'échanger un maximum de baies avec le [[Berry Master/fr|Maître des baies]]. Voici quelques configurations qu'il peut être utile de connaître. ''Note: Les auras reçues par les baies sont multiplicatives : si une baie reçoit 4 auras x1,3, alors l'effet sur cette baie sera de x(1,3^4) soit environ x2.86, si la baie reçoit 1 aura x1,2 et 2 auras x1,3, alors elle aura une aura de x(1,2 x 1,3^2) soit une aura d'environ x2,03. ==Configurations de croissance par auras== La couleur bleue indique les cases où l'utilisation du Fertipousse est recommandée. Une fois la baie prête à être récoltée, utilisez du Fertibondance pour un taux de récolte maximal. *''Astuce : Une fois que la baie a assez grandi grâce à l'aura des Parma, troquez vos Parma pour des Pocpoc afin de maximiser la récolte.'' ===Parma=== Voici la disposition de base pour donner un boost massif à la baie située dans la parcelle centrale de la ferme. Bien que la baie Parma soit utilisée ici, elle peut être échangée avec la baie Pocpoc afin de maximiser la récolte. N'oubliez pas d'utiliser la quantité appropriée d'engrais ! {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Aura de croissance maximale reçue : 8,14x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | |- style="height: 50px;" || || [[File:Wacan.png|30px]]

[[Wacan/fr|Parma]] || || |- |} ==Configurations de récolte par aura== Ces configurations sont les plus efficaces afin de récolter la plus grande quantité de baie possible.
''Le vert indique les cases où le Fertibondance doit être appliqué.'' ===Passho=== Il s'agit d'une disposition pour récolter la quantité maximale de baies dont le plan a un taux de récolte de base plus grand que 1. Cette disposition donne 6 plants avec un boost de x4.83 de taux de recolte et 4 plants avec un boost de x2.86. *Exemple : En utilisant cette répartition, en faisant pousser 10 plants de baie Aguav, avec toutes les baies Passho mûres, donnera 684 baies Aguav (ou 1 372 avec engrais riche) à chaque récolte contre 425 si la ferme est remplie de Baies Aguav (ou 850 avec engrais riche). Utiliser [[Farm Hands|Farmhand Jessie]] avec le [[Sprayduck]] équipé pour récolter les baies Aguav toutes les 4 minutes produira 40 356 baies (ou 80 712 avec engrais riche) pendant que la baie Passho est mûre.

===Passho + Petaya=== This setup yield slightly fewer berries per harvesting cycle, in exchange for vastly increased Passho ripeness time. *Example: Despite the Petaya berry taking a slot away from a Passho berry, growing 10 Aguav berries would still yield 654 Aguav berries per harvesting cycle (1,311 with Rich Mulch). However, the Petaya berry will keep all Passho berries ripe for at least 64 hours. Farmhand Jessie could harvest 618,240 Aguav berries (harvesting in 4 minute cycles) over this time. You can also simply replace a Passho in one of the corners with a 2nd Petaya. When the first Petaya's wither time is getting close to the growth time of a Petaya minus the wither time of a Passho (10 hours with just sprayduck equipped, ~6 hours 40 minutes if you use boost mulch on the 2nd petaya as well as having the sprayduck equipped). When timed correctly, you can harvest the near-death Petaya and replace it with another Passho Berry to keep this formation up indefinitely.

==Growth and Harvest Aura Setup (Wacan + Passho Handoff)== Combining the [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Wacan]] and [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Passho]] setups is incredibly useful when trying to quickly grow and harvest multiple Gen 5 berries that have a base 0.5 berry harvest yield, such as Starf or Petaya. This two-part setup, going from the Wacan formation to the following Passho formation, is the most efficient way to harvest more of these berries in the shortest amount of time. Using Farmhands Jessie or Riley to either: harvest and replant Wacans, or just replant Wacans as they wither (which is faster, but requires actively watching out for Kasib mutations on withered plots) is the best way to cultivate slow growing Gen 5 berries in a reasonable amount of time. Due to the very low harvest amount, completely surrounding each Berry with 8 Passho berries is the best way to maximize harvest amounts.
For maximum efficiency you should swap from the Wacan formation to the Passho formation before the Gen-5 berries are ripe. It takes a little bit of math to perform this swap correctly due to the Wacan Growth aura variably affecting the Gen-5 berries depending on what stage the Wacan berries are in, but if you multiply the shown 'Time until Ripe' by the 'Aura Received' you get how much longer the Gen-5 berry has until it would be ripe without the Wacan Berries' effect. Since it takes some time for the Passho berries to grow, first calculate the actual time until ripe (without modifiers), and then harvest every Wacan berry when the Gen-5 berry has less time until it's ripe than it will take the Passho to ripen (including any growth multipliers ([[Sprayduck]], [[Farm Items|Boost Mulch]]) you're using on the Passho berries. Make sure to apply [[Farm_Items|Rich Mulch]] before harvesting the Gen-5 Berries! Using this strategy will yield 32 (28 cumulative) Gen-5 berries harvested per cycle.

==[[Wandering Pokémon]] Setups== Wandering Pokemon are attracted to ripe berries. For the maximum chance of attracting a desired wandering pokemon, use one of the setups below.
===Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry=== Using a single Lum berry surrounded by 7 Roseli berries, and then filling the remainder of open Farm spots with an Attracting Berry (a Berry that attracts a particular species of Wandering Pokémon) is the most effective way of attracting Wandering Pokémon to the Farm. *''Note: Do not use this setup with Occa, Colbur, or Kebia Berries. Due to their nature of overtaking other berries, it is most efficient to simply plant 25 of those berries'' {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Encounter Chance per 1.5s: 1.29%, Attract Aura: 1.51x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | [[File:Roseli.png|30px]]

Here is the setup you need to mutate a Petaya if you shovel your only one by accident: *''Note: Don't forget to equip the [[Squirtbottle]], and use [[Farm Items|Surprise Mulch]] as this is a mutation. Purple squares are where mutations can occur.''

==Squirtbottle Leveling Strategies== Here are a few highly efficient strategies on how to level up the Squirtbottle based on which berries you have unlocked.
====Occa/Kebia Planting Formation==== If you want to be able to gain experience more passively, then the best strategy is with Occa and Kebia berries. Colbur works for this as well, but takes longer enough to grow that is isn't as useful. This strategy will likely let you level up your Squirtbottle from 0 to 5 without having to set it up again unless you get unlucky with a full takeover. Note: When using this strategy, make sure to plant the berries so that they finish at the same time to lower the chance of full takeover.

====Persim Planting Formation==== Another common strategy includes mutating [[Persim]] berries if you haven't unlocked Occa, Kebia, or Colbur yet. You can find the formation and timings on the [[Persim]] page. This is a very active strategy, but this setup should provide a little over 3.58 mutations per minute on average including time waiting for growth. This strategy is also the fastest, but needs at least about 4 and a half hours of active growth and mutation time to complete.
==Sprinklotad Leveling Strategy== The most efficient way to gain experience for the [[Sprinklotad]] is to equip the fully-leveled [[Sprayduck]] and surround 4 Kasibs with Cheris in the following way. Keep replanting Cheris as they wither while either shoveling or harvesting extra Kasibs that sprout.

revision.text:
[[File:Pokeclicker_Farm_Interface.png|400px|thumb|L'interface de la Ferme, avec différentes baies plantées.]] Il existe de nombreuses configurations de Ferme (ou : organisations des baies) ne permettant ni de faire éclore [[Pokémon_Day_Care|les œufs]] plus rapidement, ni d'augmenter les chances de rencontrer un [[Shiny Chance|Pokémon chromatique]], mais qui sont néanmoins utiles. Celles-ci peuvent notamment permettre de faire muter les baies plus rapidement, ou simplement d'augmenter les rendements de récole afin d'échanger un maximum de baies avec le [[Berry Master/fr|Maître des baies]]. Voici quelques configurations qu'il peut être utile de connaître. ''Note: Les auras reçues par les baies sont multiplicatives : si une baie reçoit 4 auras x1,3, alors l'effet sur cette baie sera de x(1,3^4) soit environ x2.86, si la baie reçoit 1 aura x1,2 et 2 auras x1,3, alors elle aura une aura de x(1,2 x 1,3^2) soit une aura d'environ x2,03. ==Configurations de croissance par auras== La couleur bleue indique les cases où l'utilisation du Fertipousse est recommandée. Une fois la baie prête à être récoltée, utilisez du Fertibondance pour un taux de récolte maximal. *''Astuce : Une fois que la baie a assez grandi grâce à l'aura des Parma, troquez vos Parma pour des Pocpoc afin de maximiser la récolte.'' ===Parma=== Voici la disposition de base pour donner un boost massif à la baie située dans la parcelle centrale de la ferme. Bien que la baie Parma soit utilisée ici, elle peut être échangée avec la baie Pocpoc afin de maximiser la récolte. N'oubliez pas d'utiliser la quantité appropriée d'engrais ! {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Aura de croissance maximale reçue : 8,14x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | |- style="height: 50px;" || || [[File:Wacan.png|30px]]

==Configurations de récolte par aura== Ces configurations sont les plus efficaces afin de récolter la plus grande quantité de baie possible.
''Le vert indique les cases où le Fertibondance doit être appliqué.'' ===Passho=== Il s'agit d'une disposition pour récolter la quantité maximale de baies dont le plan a un taux de récolte de base plus grand que 1. Cette disposition donne 6 plants avec un boost de x4.83 de taux de recolte et 4 plants avec un boost de x2.86. *Exemple : En utilisant cette répartition, en faisant pousser 10 plants de baie Aguav, avec toutes les baies Passho mûres, donnera 684 baies Aguav (ou 1 372 avec engrais riche) à chaque récolte contre 425 si la ferme est remplie de Baies Aguav (ou 850 avec engrais riche). Utiliser [[Farm Hands|Farmhand Jessie]] avec le [[Sprayduck]] équipé pour récolter les baies Aguav toutes les 4 minutes produira 40 356 baies (ou 80 712 avec engrais riche) pendant que la baie Passho est mûre.
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Maximum Harvest Aura Bonuses: 6 Plots - 4.83x, 4 Plots - 2.86x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | [[File:Passho.png|30px]]

===Passho + Petaya=== This setup yield slightly fewer berries per harvesting cycle, in exchange for vastly increased Passho ripeness time. *Example: Despite the Petaya berry taking a slot away from a Passho berry, growing 10 Aguav berries would still yield 654 Aguav berries per harvesting cycle (1,311 with Rich Mulch). However, the Petaya berry will keep all Passho berries ripe for at least 64 hours. Farmhand Jessie could harvest 618,240 Aguav berries (harvesting in 4 minute cycles) over this time. You can also simply replace a Passho in one of the corners with a 2nd Petaya. When the first Petaya's wither time is getting close to the growth time of a Petaya minus the wither time of a Passho (10 hours with just sprayduck equipped, ~6 hours 40 minutes if you use boost mulch on the 2nd petaya as well as having the sprayduck equipped). When timed correctly, you can harvest the near-death Petaya and replace it with another Passho Berry to keep this formation up indefinitely.

==Growth and Harvest Aura Setup (Wacan + Passho Handoff)== Combining the [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Wacan]] and [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Passho]] setups is incredibly useful when trying to quickly grow and harvest multiple Gen 5 berries that have a base 0.5 berry harvest yield, such as Starf or Petaya. This two-part setup, going from the Wacan formation to the following Passho formation, is the most efficient way to harvest more of these berries in the shortest amount of time. Using Farmhands Jessie or Riley to either: harvest and replant Wacans, or just replant Wacans as they wither (which is faster, but requires actively watching out for Kasib mutations on withered plots) is the best way to cultivate slow growing Gen 5 berries in a reasonable amount of time. Due to the very low harvest amount, completely surrounding each Berry with 8 Passho berries is the best way to maximize harvest amounts.
For maximum efficiency you should swap from the Wacan formation to the Passho formation before the Gen-5 berries are ripe. It takes a little bit of math to perform this swap correctly due to the Wacan Growth aura variably affecting the Gen-5 berries depending on what stage the Wacan berries are in, but if you multiply the shown 'Time until Ripe' by the 'Aura Received' you get how much longer the Gen-5 berry has until it would be ripe without the Wacan Berries' effect. Since it takes some time for the Passho berries to grow, first calculate the actual time until ripe (without modifiers), and then harvest every Wacan berry when the Gen-5 berry has less time until it's ripe than it will take the Passho to ripen (including any growth multipliers ([[Sprayduck]], [[Farm Items|Boost Mulch]]) you're using on the Passho berries. Make sure to apply [[Farm_Items|Rich Mulch]] before harvesting the Gen-5 Berries! Using this strategy will yield 32 (28 cumulative) Gen-5 berries harvested per cycle.

==[[Wandering Pokémon]] Setups== Wandering Pokemon are attracted to ripe berries. For the maximum chance of attracting a desired wandering pokemon, use one of the setups below.
===Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry=== Using a single Lum berry surrounded by 7 Roseli berries, and then filling the remainder of open Farm spots with an Attracting Berry (a Berry that attracts a particular species of Wandering Pokémon) is the most effective way of attracting Wandering Pokémon to the Farm. *''Note: Do not use this setup with Occa, Colbur, or Kebia Berries. Due to their nature of overtaking other berries, it is most efficient to simply plant 25 of those berries'' {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Encounter Chance per 1.5s: 1.29%, Attract Aura: 1.51x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | [[File:Roseli.png|30px]]

This doesn't decrease the encounter chance per second significantly, but it does make this setup viable for several days instead of several hours.

==Squirtbottle Leveling Strategies== Here are a few highly efficient strategies on how to level up the Squirtbottle based on which berries you have unlocked.
====Occa/Kebia Planting Formation==== If you want to be able to gain experience more passively, then the best strategy is with Occa and Kebia berries. Colbur works for this as well, but takes longer enough to grow that is isn't as useful. This strategy will likely let you level up your Squirtbottle from 0 to 5 without having to set it up again unless you get unlucky with a full takeover. Note: When using this strategy, make sure to plant the berries so that they finish at the same time to lower the chance of full takeover.

====Persim Planting Formation==== Another common strategy includes mutating [[Persim]] berries if you haven't unlocked Occa, Kebia, or Colbur yet. You can find the formation and timings on the [[Persim]] page. This is a very active strategy, but this setup should provide a little over 3.58 mutations per minute on average including time waiting for growth. This strategy is also the fastest, but needs at least about 4 and a half hours of active growth and mutation time to complete.
==Sprinklotad Leveling Strategy== The most efficient way to gain experience for the [[Sprinklotad]] is to equip the fully-leveled [[Sprayduck]] and surround 4 Kasibs with Cheris in the following way. Keep replanting Cheris as they wither while either shoveling or harvesting extra Kasibs that sprout.

revision.text:
[[File:Pokeclicker_Farm_Interface.png|400px|thumb|L'interface de la Ferme, avec différentes baies plantées.]] Il existe de nombreuses configurations de Ferme (ou : organisations des baies) ne permettant ni de faire éclore [[Pokémon_Day_Care|les œufs]] plus rapidement, ni d'augmenter les chances de rencontrer un [[Shiny Chance|Pokémon chromatique]], mais qui sont néanmoins utiles. Celles-ci peuvent notamment permettre de faire muter les baies plus rapidement, ou simplement d'augmenter les rendements de récole afin d'échanger un maximum de baies avec le [[Berry Master/fr|Maître des baies]]. Voici quelques configurations qu'il peut être utile de connaître. ''Note: Les auras reçues par les baies sont multiplicatives : si une baie reçoit 4 auras x1,3, alors l'effet sur cette baie sera de x(1,3^4) soit environ x2.86, si la baie reçoit 1 aura x1,2 et 2 auras x1,3, alors elle aura une aura de x(1,2 x 1,3^2) soit une aura d'environ x2,03. ==Configurations de croissance par auras== La couleur bleue indique les cases où l'utilisation du Fertipousse est recommandée. Une fois la baie prête à être récoltée, utilisez du Fertibondance pour un taux de récolte maximal. *''Astuce : Une fois que la baie a assez grandi grâce à l'aura des Parma, troquez vos Parma pour des Pocpoc afin de maximiser la récolte.'' ===Parma=== Voici la disposition de base pour donner un boost massif à la baie située dans la parcelle centrale de la ferme. Bien que la baie Parma soit utilisée ici, elle peut être échangée avec la baie Pocpoc afin de maximiser la récolte. N'oubliez pas d'utiliser la quantité appropriée d'engrais ! {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Aura de croissance maximale reçue : 8,14x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | || style="width: 20%;" | |- style="height: 50px;" || || [[File:Wacan.png|30px]]

==Configurations de récolte par aura== Ces configurations sont les plus efficaces afin de récolter la plus grande quantité de baie possible.
''Le vert indique les cases où le Fertibondance doit être appliqué.'' ===Passho=== Il s'agit d'une disposition pour récolter la quantité maximale de baies dont le plan a un taux de récolte de base plus grand que 1. Cette disposition donne 6 plants avec un boost de x4.83 de taux de recolte et 4 plants avec un boost de x2.86. *Exemple : En utilisant cette répartition, en faisant pousser 10 plants de baie Aguav, avec toutes les baies Passho mûres, donnera 684 baies Aguav (ou 1 372 avec engrais riche) à chaque récolte contre 425 si la ferme est remplie de Baies Aguav (ou 850 avec engrais riche). Utiliser [[Farm Hands|Farmhand Jessie]] avec le [[Sprayduck]] équipé pour récolter les baies Aguav toutes les 4 minutes produira 40 356 baies (ou 80 712 avec engrais riche) pendant que la baie Passho est mûre.

===Passho + Petaya=== This setup yield slightly fewer berries per harvesting cycle, in exchange for vastly increased Passho ripeness time. *Example: Despite the Petaya berry taking a slot away from a Passho berry, growing 10 Aguav berries would still yield 654 Aguav berries per harvesting cycle (1,311 with Rich Mulch). However, the Petaya berry will keep all Passho berries ripe for at least 64 hours. Farmhand Jessie could harvest 618,240 Aguav berries (harvesting in 4 minute cycles) over this time. You can also simply replace a Passho in one of the corners with a 2nd Petaya. When the first Petaya's wither time is getting close to the growth time of a Petaya minus the wither time of a Passho (10 hours with just sprayduck equipped, ~6 hours 40 minutes if you use boost mulch on the 2nd petaya as well as having the sprayduck equipped). When timed correctly, you can harvest the near-death Petaya and replace it with another Passho Berry to keep this formation up indefinitely.

==Growth and Harvest Aura Setup (Wacan + Passho Handoff)== Combining the [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Wacan]] and [[Farming Setups#Wacan|Passho]] setups is incredibly useful when trying to quickly grow and harvest multiple Gen 5 berries that have a base 0.5 berry harvest yield, such as Starf or Petaya. This two-part setup, going from the Wacan formation to the following Passho formation, is the most efficient way to harvest more of these berries in the shortest amount of time. Using Farmhands Jessie or Riley to either: harvest and replant Wacans, or just replant Wacans as they wither (which is faster, but requires actively watching out for Kasib mutations on withered plots) is the best way to cultivate slow growing Gen 5 berries in a reasonable amount of time. Due to the very low harvest amount, completely surrounding each Berry with 8 Passho berries is the best way to maximize harvest amounts.
For maximum efficiency you should swap from the Wacan formation to the Passho formation before the Gen-5 berries are ripe. It takes a little bit of math to perform this swap correctly due to the Wacan Growth aura variably affecting the Gen-5 berries depending on what stage the Wacan berries are in, but if you multiply the shown 'Time until Ripe' by the 'Aura Received' you get how much longer the Gen-5 berry has until it would be ripe without the Wacan Berries' effect. Since it takes some time for the Passho berries to grow, first calculate the actual time until ripe (without modifiers), and then harvest every Wacan berry when the Gen-5 berry has less time until it's ripe than it will take the Passho to ripen (including any growth multipliers ([[Sprayduck]], [[Farm Items|Boost Mulch]]) you're using on the Passho berries. Make sure to apply [[Farm_Items|Rich Mulch]] before harvesting the Gen-5 Berries! Using this strategy will yield 32 (28 cumulative) Gen-5 berries harvested per cycle.

==[[Wandering Pokémon]] Setups== Wandering Pokemon are attracted to ripe berries. For the maximum chance of attracting a desired wandering pokemon, use one of the setups below.
===Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry=== Using a single Lum berry surrounded by 7 Roseli berries, and then filling the remainder of open Farm spots with an Attracting Berry (a Berry that attracts a particular species of Wandering Pokémon) is the most effective way of attracting Wandering Pokémon to the Farm. *''Note: Do not use this setup with Occa, Colbur, or Kebia Berries. Due to their nature of overtaking other berries, it is most efficient to simply plant 25 of those berries'' {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ '''''Encounter Chance per 1.5s: 1.29%, Attract Aura: 1.51x''''' |- style="height: 50px;" | style="width: 20%;" | [[File:Roseli.png|30px]]

===Roseli + Lum + Petaya + Attracting Berry ===
For a significantly longer uptime than [[Farming Setups#Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry|Roseli + Lum + Attracting Berry]] to attract a Wandering Pokémon - perhaps if you're looking for a specific pokemon or group of pokemon to turn shiny for example - replace a Roseli Berry with a Petaya berry. This doesn't decrease the encounter chance per second significantly, but it does make this setup viable for several days instead of several hours.

==Squirtbottle Leveling Strategies== Here are a few highly efficient strategies on how to level up the Squirtbottle based on which berries you have unlocked.
====Occa/Kebia Planting Formation==== If you want to be able to gain experience more passively, then the best strategy is with Occa and Kebia berries. Colbur works for this as well, but takes longer enough to grow that is isn't as useful. This strategy will likely let you level up your Squirtbottle from 0 to 5 without having to set it up again unless you get unlucky with a full takeover. Note: When using this strategy, make sure to plant the berries so that they finish at the same time to lower the chance of full takeover.

====Persim Planting Formation==== Another common strategy includes mutating [[Persim]] berries if you haven't unlocked Occa, Kebia, or Colbur yet. You can find the formation and timings on the [[Persim]] page. This is a very active strategy, but this setup should provide a little over 3.58 mutations per minute on average including time waiting for growth. This strategy is also the fastest, but needs at least about 4 and a half hours of active growth and mutation time to complete.
==Sprinklotad Leveling Strategy== The most efficient way to gain experience for the [[Sprinklotad]] is to equip the fully-leveled [[Sprayduck]] and surround 4 Kasibs with Cheris in the following way. Keep replanting Cheris as they wither while either shoveling or harvesting extra Kasibs that sprout.
